image.altText: Novak Djokovic raises his first in triumph, looking stern, during a night tennis match

props.synopsis: Novak Djokovic and Alexander Zverev face off in the first men's semifinal of the Australian Open. Follow live.

title.children: Djokovic plays historic 50th grand slam semi against Zverev at Aus Open

image.altText: A close up of Jack Schlossberg speaking, with his right hand over his heart

props.synopsis: Jack Schlossberg, John F Kennedy's only grandson, has slammed Donald Trump's decision to declassify documents relating to the late president's assassination, saying JFK is being used as a "political prop".

title.children: Jack Schlossberg slams Trump over release of JFK assassination records

image.altText: cctv image of two people dressed in black hoodies one on a bike outside a synagogue in newtown

props.synopsis: Several red swastikas were also graffitied along the front fence of the Newtown Synagogue on January 11.

title.children: Second man charged over alleged attempt to set fire to Sydney synagogue

image.altText: A middle-aged bald man with glasses in a suit speaks outside.

props.synopsis: The opposition leader said the government's stance on the Gaza war made the foreign minister "the most inappropriate person" to attend.

title.children: Dutton says Wong should not represent Australia at Auschwitz commemoration

image.altText: Mark Zuckerberg, Jeff Bezos, Sundar Pichai and Elon Musk standing on a stage

props.synopsis: There’s no official ruling on the collective noun for a group of billionaires, but if ever we needed one it was this week, writes Ange Lavoipierre.

title.children: How the new 'tech oligarchy' under Donald Trump will reshape the world

image.altText: AA NPC 2024

props.synopsis: The prime minister has used his first National Press Club address of 2025 to launch the government's "cash for apprentices" policy, while facing questions about the cost of living, Australia Day, and his falling popularity. Follow live.

title.children: Albanese says it's the opposition that should 'toughen up', defends record on cost of living and antisemitism

image.altText: Alex Cullen smiling, wearing a black suit and bow tie with a white button-up shirt.

props.synopsis: Today hosts Karl Stefanovic and Sarah Abo addressed the journalist's absence on air this morning, telling viewers he would "finish with the network".

title.children: Nine's Alex Cullen to leave Today show over 'Lambo guy' controversy

image.altText: A woman, with a panicked expression on her face, holds two children.

props.synopsis: A video of Shiri Bibas and her two young children being kidnapped on October 7 made headlines around the world. Hamas says they've been killed, but many Israeli's don't believe them, and the tragic mystery will likely soon be solved.

title.children: The video shocked the world, and now Israelis are holding their breath

image.altText: An Australian one-dollar coin, placed on top of US dollars.

props.synopsis: The ASX 200 is on track for a weekly gain. The Australian dollar rallies against the greenback after US President Donald Trump tells Fox News he could make a deal with China. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: Aussie dollar hits five-week high on Trump's China comments, ASX rises

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Bank of Japan increases key interest rate to 17-year high
Sotheby's records another year of declining art sales

image.altText: The PM with a face mask

props.synopsis: It's been about five years since the first case of COVID-19 was confirmed in Australia. This is what Australia living through "unprecedented times" looks like in numbers.

title.children: COVID-19 hit Australia five years ago. These numbers show its impact

image.altText: Karla Sofía Gascón walking through a public space with a bag on her shoulder.

props.synopsis: Trans actress Karla Sofía Gascón makes Oscars history, an Australian cinematographer heading for gold and more from today's Academy Award nominations

title.children: All the snubs, surprises and successes in the 2025 Oscar nominations

image.altText: Axel Rudakubana pulls his lips over his teeth in a mugshot, with his black hair sticking up and eyes looking into the camera.

props.synopsis: Axel Rudakubana, who murdered three young girls and injured several more people in a mass stabbing attack at a Taylor Swift dance class in England's north west last year, is sentenced to 52 years behind bars.

title.children: Teen who killed three UK kids searched for Sydney stabbing video before attack

image.altText: Baby Penguin sitting in a burrow

props.synopsis: A sudden drop in adult little penguin numbers at Bicheno on Tasmania's east coast has led to alarm for the fate of the colony as penguin chicks reliant on parents are seen dying.

title.children: Tours cancelled as adult penguins fail to return to young at seaside town

image.altText: A young Aboriginal girl is doing ballet wearing traditional clothes. She is wearing brown emu feathers and is painted in ochre

props.synopsis: Australia Day brings up mixed emotions and opinions for many people. Despite this, there is a growth in First Nations cultural festivals being held on the day and this is why.

title.children: ‘Don’t let politics divide us’: Why there’s growth of First Nations festivals on Jan 26

image.altText: Guitarists of Franz Ferdinand stand in line and perform on stage in sharp red and black suits

props.synopsis: Born in a dingy Glasgow flat, Franz Ferdinand's biggest hit became a foundational part of the 2000s indie-rock boom and Hottest 100 lore.

title.children: How the Hottest 100 winner from 20 years ago was inspired by a sniper duel

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A smiling woman standing in a high green crop, wears black, has short black hair, glasses. Blue sky with clouds scattered.

props.synopsis: A flooding event has enabled cereal and hay crops to be grown on dry lake beds in far western NSW, presenting a unique opportunity for some pastoralists.

title.children: Once-in-10-years floodwaters turn dry lake beds into oasis of green

image.altText: A photo of Maria Dimasi wearing a red blouse

props.synopsis: A 93-year-old man has been found mentally unfit to stand trial for the murder of his wife, and therefore not guilty.

title.children: Children of 85yo woman killed by her husband can't forgive 'evil act'

image.altText: Police tape in the foreground with trees and car in the background

props.synopsis: Detectives from the Child Protection Investigation Unit and specialist police from Crime and Intelligence Command's Child Trauma Unit are investigating the death of a two-month-old girl.

title.children: Two-month-old baby girl dies in Brisbane hospital after suffering 'life-threatening injuries'

image.altText: statue wrapped in black plastic and cordoned off by fencing

props.synopsis: Vandals have caused $140,000 damage to several bronze statues of prime ministers in Ballarat Botanical Gardens.

title.children: Prime ministers' heads severed and stolen from bronze statues in Ballarat

image.altText: An elderly woman with white wavy hair and glasses wears a blue dress with a white flower on her lapel and sits in a home.

props.synopsis: After a renewed public appeal, police have arrested a 69-year-old man in connection with two separate assaults of an elderly woman more than 40 years ago.

title.children: Man arrested four decades after sex assaults on elderly Melbourne woman

image.altText: Crowds of people hold their nose while they look on at a large flower blooming inside a tent.

props.synopsis: More than 20,000 people have lined up to get a whiff of the rare flower which stinks like "chicken you've left out a little too long".

title.children: It's official: Sydney's hottest ticket in town absolutely stinks

image.altText: A semi-trailer trailer on fire at night

props.synopsis: A semitrailer carrying toilet paper catches fire while driving through dry farmland and pine forests in south-western Victoria, but "luck" and cooperation prevent the blaze from causing a much larger disaster.

title.children: Truck carrying toilet paper bursts into flames but bushfire prevented

image.altText: Randwick's Captain James Cook statue splashed with red paint

props.synopsis: A statue of Captain James Cook in Sydney's east has been splashed with red paint and had the sandstone damaged for the second time in 12 months.

title.children: Sydney Captain Cook statue splashed with red paint ahead of Australia Day

image.altText: Blue police tape near crime scene

props.synopsis: Nine people have been charged over their involvement in antisemitic attacks in Sydney, but none have been charged with terrorism. Researchers say it's harder to meet that threshold.

title.children: Why Sydney's antisemitic attacks do not meet the definition of terrorism

image.altText: A close up of Anthony Albanese in a suit.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese points to the array of measures his government has taken to tackle the scourge of antisemitism. But he can't escape the impression of seeming perennially on the back foot and often lacking adequate empathy and sensitivity in dealing with the issue.

title.children: Albanese struggles to strike the right note on antisemitism

image.altText: Green plant and smoke in front of brown curtain

props.synopsis: Have you been paying attention to the news this week? Let's see what you've got.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Trump's comeback and a blooming corpse flower

props.synopsis: Socceroos coach Tony Popovic says former boy wonder Daniel Arzani hasn't been good enough to earn a national spot, challenging the attacker to lift his standards.

title.children: 'Really poor': Socceroos coach's blistering analysis of former boy wonder

image.altText: A man looks at the camera with a blank expression. There is a flag flying in the background.

props.synopsis: The Australian flag can evoke a range of feelings from pride and camaraderie to exclusion and division. Here are some reasons why these people have made it a feature of their homes.

title.children: Inside the yards where the Australian flag flies high

image.altText: A woman with hair tied back in a bun, wears green tee, black shorts, leans into a child holding a workbook.

props.synopsis: Back-to-school preparations are in full swing, but a growing number of parents are abandoning traditional education.

title.children: More parents turn to homeschooling as attitudes towards education change

image.altText: A man cleans an elephant foot through a metal cage.

props.synopsis: Moving home is always stressful. But for Melbourne's much-loved elephants, a shift to Werribee promises to help the herd grow and thrive.

title.children: Keepers hope tragedy at Melbourne Zoo can save the rest of the herd

image.altText: Two people smiling at camera with dog in between

props.synopsis: Two sets of walking shoes, sunscreen, dehydrated food and a rain and wind-proof jacket are some of the items Elise Smith packed for her assistance dog Lenny, who joined her for a 65-kilometre trek in Tasmania.

title.children: How Elise's small and fluffy assistance dog made a six-day hike possible

image.altText: GettyImages-1441425880

props.synopsis: Jillaroos coach Brad Donald is awaiting the results of an investigation into comments he allegedly made about a journalist.

title.children: Jillaroos coach faces uncertain future as NRL investigates alleged 'disparaging comment'

props.synopsis: Italian pilot Dario Costa reached a top speed of 350 km/h as he followed one of the world's most difficult downhill ski runs.

title.children: Italian stunt pilot flies down Austria's legendary Streif ski run
